This Week’s Best EDM, Featuring RL Grime, A-Trak, and Baauer

posted by khal on November 1, 2014 in Audio

Image via free-desktop-backgrounds.net

We’re less than 24 hours removed from Halloween, and I’m over here munching on my son’s candy while trying to get over how dope of a week we had in electronic music. Maybe that’s the wrong mentality; I don’t want to get over it. Let’s just turn these songs into dead leaves, rake them into a pile, and roll around in them for a bit. Who’s with me?

Baauer ft. AlunaGeorge & Rae Sremmurd – “One Touch”

The VIP was cool, but the original? Everything about this track is sweet, sexy, and banging. You can stream the EP it’s taken from before it drops next week. #ijustpoppedasensubean

RL Grime’s Halloween Mix 2014

RL Grime’s back for the third year in a row, giving us a Halloween mix featuring an intro from the legendary RL Stine. This is all the turnup you need this weekend, trust.

A-Trak ft. Andrew Wyatt – “Push”

This anthemic potential radio smash from A-Trak was super unexpected, but highlights how diverse his sound can really be.

Tiga ft. Pusha T – “Bugatti (Zed Bias Dub)”

Zed Bias won with his perfect edit of Tiga’s Pusha T-featured “Bugatti.”

Skream – “Pernicious”

Skream comes correct with the brooding 10-minute techno jams.

Moon Boots – “There’s No Love”

Moon Boots is really shining, and this space-y house tune should help bring in a number of new fans.

Majid Jordan – “Her (Stwo Edit)”

I’m not saying Stwo’s putting in his bid to be a part of OVO Sound, but he really should be a part of OVO Sound.

The first single from Melé’s new label, Quadrants

Melé’s back with a new imprint, and kicks it off with two gorgeous productions. “The Ritzy” is the funky future, while “Learn 2 Love” is the beautiful past.

Mad Decent’s “What Is A Jeffree?” Compilation

Mad Decent’s three-year-old free imprint Jeffree’s is all about bringing you the future of electronic music, including being the place many first heard acts like Baauer and DJ Snake. They keep that ethos popping with this free 12-track compilation.

Flying Lotus – “Ready Err Not”

You knew this amazingly disturbing clip was going to make it… right? Roll credits.

Tags:  A-Trak, baauer, EDM, flying lotus, Melé, RL Grime, Skream, stwo
